About Us!

PaintBox Theatre is a theatre of improvisation and imagination for the whole family. Audiences young and old have called it unique, wild, zany, and even educational. Audience members range in age from 1 to 100 and include parents, seniors and other adults.
To bring a classic tale to life the Paintbox way- start with the story, fold in art and literacy, stir. Voila! Out pops a funny, fanciful show that appeals to young and old.


Start with a children's classic. Add three actors. Add a theatre, the Paintbox stage & a screen. Add artwork (by kids). Add lots of audience participation & improvisation. Stir well. There you go: Paintbox!

We opened last weekend and had a blast. Here's a link to an article that appeared - The Advocate
and a comment on Facebook

Jessica wrote: "my girls and I saw your Sat. show and thank you so much for giving me a chance to share a happy Christmas memory at a time when every second with our kids is precious. the show was terrific of course, as always:)"


We will be doing shows this Friday at 7:00 and Saturday at 10:30 and 1:00. Please Pass the Word!

PaintBox Theatre has adapted Christmas Carol as a child-friendly romp featuring lots of audience participation and holiday cheer.

You'll sing carols, participate in not one but two snowball fights with invisible snowballs and everyone will learn how to waltz.

More than 50 children artists drawing pictures based on characters and locations from this Dickens classic. The pictures will be projected above the stage throughout the performance.

There'll be a carol sing in the lobby during intermission and pre-show several members of the audience will be offered parts in the show as the Cratchit children. Yes, even Tiny Tim.
